qas.question: What concerns have reduced Minor League exhibition games?

answers.text: worries of injuries to players, along with travel issues

qas.question: What inter-city exhibition game did Chicago have?
What inter-city exhibition game did New York have?
In what month is the MLB All-Star Game held?
What did the MLB All-Star winning team gain in the World Series?

plausible_answers.text: have a team play an exhibition against Minor League affiliates

qas.question: What kind of exhibition game is still popular between major and minor league teams?

plausible_answers.text: worries of injuries to players, along with travel issues

qas.question: What made these type of exhibition games more popular?
What kind of play is now for bragging rights only
What does the loser of the All-Star game get the following year
What game between two AL teams is considered an exhibition gave

context: It also used to be commonplace to <b5_0>have a team play an exhibition against Minor League affiliates<b5_0/> during the regular season, but <a0_0><b6_0>worries of injuries to players, along with travel issues<b6_0/><a0_0/>, have made this very rare. Exhibitions between inter-city teams in different leagues, like Chicago's <a1_0>Crosstown Classic<a1_0/> and New York's <a2_0>Subway Series<a2_0/> which used to be played solely as exhibitions for bragging rights are now blended into <b7_0>interleague play<b7_0/>. The annual <b9_0>MLB All-Star Game<b9_0/>, played in <a3_0>July<a3_0/> between players from AL teams and players from NL teams, was long considered an exhibition match, but as of 2003 this status was questioned because the league whose team wins the All-Star game has been awarded <a4_0><b8_0>home field advantage<b8_0/><a4_0/> for the upcoming World Series.
